elements.content: Zn10(Im)20·4DBF: an unprecedented 10-nodal zeolitic topology with a 10-MR channel and 10 crystallographically independent Zn atoms† Qi Shi Xiaozhen Kang Fa-Nian Shi and Jinxiang Dong 1223–72a8,94,52a,103,5103,5113b3b5c(a) A ball-and-stick representation of the asymmetric unit of Zn10(Im)20·4DBF (guests were omitted for clarity and the gray Zn10′ atom and Im molecules were added); (b) the ball-and-stick diagram shows that the Zn10 atom plays a key role in the interconnection of the 10-MR (Im molecules and guests were omitted); (c) polyhedron representation of the supercell (2 × 2 × 2) framework (guest DBF were not removed from the middle pores).

(a) A ball-and-stick representation of the asymmetric unit of Zn10(Im)20⋅4DBF (guests were omitted for clarity and the gray Zn10' atom and Im molecules were added); (b) the ball-and-stick diagram shows that the Zn10 atom plays a key role in the interconnection of the 10-MR (Im molecules and guests were omitted); (c) polyhedron representation of the supercell (2 × 2 × 2) framework (guest DBF were not removed from the middle pores).

elements.content: Fig. 1 (a) A ball-and-stick representation of the asymmetric unit of Zn10(Im)20·4DBF (guests were omitted for clarity and the gray Zn10′ atom and Im molecules were added); (b) the ball-and-stick diagram shows that the Zn10 atom plays a key role in the interconnection of the 10-MR (Im molecules and guests were omitted); (c) polyhedron representation of the supercell (2 × 2 × 2) framework (guest DBF were not removed from the middle pores).

elements.content: 3bRoute expression of the shortest ring on each angle of Zn atoms in Zn10(Im)20·4DBF (10-nodal net, 10 independent Zn atoms are shown in coordination sequences of Zn1, Zn2, Zn3, Zn4, Zn5, Zn6, Zn7, Zn8, Zn9 and Zn10, which have 10 topologically distinct kinds of vertices, Table S3, ESI†).
elements.clean_text:
3b

Route expression of the shortest ring on each angle of Zn atoms in Zn10(Im)20⋅4DBF (10-nodal net, 10 independent Zn atoms are shown in coordination sequences of Zn1, Zn2, Zn3, Zn4, Zn5, Zn6, Zn7, Zn8, Zn9 and Zn10, which have 10 topologically distinct kinds of vertices, Table S3, ESI†).

elements.content: Fig. 2 Route expression of the shortest ring on each angle of Zn atoms in Zn10(Im)20·4DBF (10-nodal net, 10 independent Zn atoms are shown in coordination sequences of Zn1, Zn2, Zn3, Zn4, Zn5, Zn6, Zn7, Zn8, Zn9 and Zn10, which have 10 topologically distinct kinds of vertices, Table S3, ESI†).
elements.clean_text: Fig. 2  Route expression of the shortest ring on each angle of Zn atoms in Zn10(Im)20⋅4DBF (10-nodal net, 10 independent Zn atoms are shown in coordination sequences of Zn1, Zn2, Zn3, Zn4, Zn5, Zn6, Zn7, Zn8, Zn9 and Zn10, which have 10 topologically distinct kinds of vertices, Table S3, ESI†).

elements.content: Fig. 3 (a) The topology structure of Zn10(Im)20·4DBF; (b) the simple tiling of the 3-periodic net in Zn10(Im)20·4DBF shows only a primitive proper tiling (PPT1); (c) the 3D net of PPT1 when all tiles were removed showing various 1D channels formed with various rings (all viewed along the a axis).
